item.description: Create a temp table as a base table for fixing incorrect usage. This table will only include rows where cpu, or mem, or io, or iow is > 0, otherwise on large databases the fix would not be possible.
item.sql: CREATE TABLE base_for_fixing AS SELECT ju_id, ju_parent, ju_start_time, ju_end_time, ju_exit_status, ju_failed, ju_cpu, ju_mem, ju_io, ju_iow FROM sge_job_usage WHERE ju_mem > 0 OR ju_cpu > 0 OR ju_io > 0 OR ju_iow > 0
CREATE INDEX base_for_fixing_idx1 ON base_for_fixing (ju_id)
CREATE INDEX base_for_fixing_idx2 ON base_for_fixing (ju_parent)
ANALYZE

item.description: Create view view_fixed_usages - view containing the correct usages (ju_cpu, ju_mem, ju_io, ju_iow) for the intermediate line.
item.sql: CREATE VIEW view_fixed_usages AS SELECT u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id, CASE WHEN ((2*max(u2.ju_cpu) - sum(u2.ju_cpu)) > 0) AND (2*max(u2.ju_mem) - sum(u2.ju_mem) > 0) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS perform_fix, 2*max(u2.ju_cpu) - sum(u2.ju_cpu) as ju_cpu, 2*max(u2.ju_mem) - sum(u2.ju_mem) as ju_mem, 2*max(u2.ju_io) - sum(u2.ju_io) as ju_io, 2*max(u2.ju_iow) - sum(u2.ju_iow) as ju_iow FROM base_for_fixing u1 LEFT OUTER JOIN base_for_fixing u2 ON u2.ju_parent = u1.ju_parent GROUP BY u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id, u1.ju_cpu, u1.ju_mem, u1.ju_io, u1.ju_iow HAVING u1.ju_id = max(u2.ju_id) ORDER BY u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id

item.description: Update sge_job_usage with the correct ju_cpu, ju_mem, ju_io, ju_iow values for the intermediate line
item.sql: UPDATE sge_job_usage SET ju_cpu = n.ju_cpu, ju_mem = n.ju_mem, ju_io = n.ju_io, ju_iow = n.ju_iow FROM view_fixed_usages n WHERE sge_job_usage.ju_id = n.ju_id AND perform_fix = 1

item.description: Create view view_fixed_stimes - view containing the correct start_times for the intermediate line and ju_exit_status.
item.sql: CREATE VIEW view_fixed_stimes AS SELECT u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id, coalesce(max(u2.ju_end_time), u1.ju_start_time) AS fstart_time, u1.ju_end_time, CASE WHEN u1.ju_end_time = max(u3.ju_end_time) then u1.ju_exit_status ELSE -1 END AS fexit_status FROM base_for_fixing u1 LEFT OUTER JOIN base_for_fixing u2 ON u2.ju_parent = u1.ju_parent AND u2.ju_end_time < u1.ju_end_time AND u2.ju_start_time = u1.ju_start_time LEFT OUTER JOIN base_for_fixing u3 ON u3.ju_parent = u1.ju_parent GROUP BY u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id, u1.ju_start_time, u1.ju_end_time, u1.ju_exit_status ORDER BY u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id

item.description: Update sge_job_usage with the correct ju_start_time values for intermediate lines and ju_exit_status.
item.sql: UPDATE sge_job_usage SET ju_start_time = n.fstart_time, ju_exit_status = n.fexit_status FROM view_fixed_stimes n WHERE sge_job_usage.ju_id = n.ju_id

CREATE VIEW view_accounting AS SELECT sge_job.j_job_number AS job_number, sge_job.j_task_number AS task_number, sge_job.j_pe_taskid AS pe_taskid, sge_job.j_job_name AS name, sge_job.j_group AS "group", sge_job.j_owner AS username, sge_job.j_account AS account, sge_job.j_project AS project, sge_job.j_department AS department, sge_job.j_submission_time AS submission_time, sge_job_usage.ju_start_time AS start_time, sge_job_usage.ju_end_time AS end_time, sge_job_usage.ju_ru_wallclock AS wallclock_time, sge_job_usage.ju_cpu AS cpu, sge_job_usage.ju_mem AS mem, sge_job_usage.ju_io AS io, sge_job_usage.ju_iow AS iow, sge_job_usage.ju_maxvmem AS maxvmem, sge_job_usage.ju_exit_status AS exit_status FROM sge_job, sge_job_usage WHERE sge_job.j_id = sge_job_usage.ju_parent AND sge_job_usage.ju_start_time >= sge_job.j_submission_time
GRANT SELECT ON view_accounting TO {READ_USER}

CREATE VIEW view_job_times AS SELECT u1.j_job_number AS job_number, u1.j_task_number AS task_number, u1.j_job_name AS name, u1.j_group AS groupname, u1.j_owner AS username, u1.j_account AS account, u1.j_project AS project, u1.j_department AS department, u1.j_submission_time AS submission_time, u2.start_time, u2.end_time, u2.start_time - u1.j_submission_time AS wait_time, u2.end_time - u1.j_submission_time AS turnaround_time, u2.end_time - u2.start_time AS job_duration, u2.wallclock_time, u2.exit_status FROM sge_job u1 JOIN ( SELECT sge_job.j_id, min(sge_job_usage.ju_start_time) AS start_time, max(sge_job_usage.ju_end_time) AS end_time, max(sge_job_usage.ju_ru_wallclock) AS wallclock_time, max(sge_job_usage.ju_exit_status) AS exit_status FROM sge_job, sge_job_usage WHERE sge_job.j_id = sge_job_usage.ju_parent AND sge_job_usage.ju_start_time >= sge_job.j_submission_time GROUP BY sge_job.j_id) u2 ON u1.j_id = u2.j_id WHERE u2.start_time >= u1.j_submission_time AND u1.j_pe_taskid = 'NONE'::text
GRANT SELECT ON view_job_times TO {READ_USER}

CREATE VIEW view_jobs_completed AS SELECT date_trunc('hour'::text, sge_job_usage.ju_end_time) AS "time", count(sge_job_usage.ju_id) AS completed FROM sge_job, sge_job_usage WHERE sge_job.j_id = sge_job_usage.ju_parent AND sge_job_usage.ju_exit_status != -1 AND sge_job.j_pe_taskid = 'NONE'::text GROUP BY date_trunc('hour'::text, sge_job_usage.ju_end_time)
